Articles.Content:
I have installed the Trajectories mod on my KSP. In the description it is written that it's compatibe with FAR. However, in game it shows "Drag model: unknown". When i had NEAR Trajectories recognized it. I am aware that mod is made for KSP 0.25.

Any help will be appreciated.
Make sure you have the latest version of both Trajectories and FAR. There was a bug in some of the earlier 0.90 versions of FAR that prevented Trajectories from doing the appropriate calculations.
I have a similar problem: Trajectories' landing spot prediction consistently overshoots the actual landing spot. It seems to actually use the FAR model though, given its reaction to changing the AoA.

I have a similar problem: Trajectories' landing spot prediction consistently overshoots the actual landing spot. It seems to actually use the FAR model though, given its reaction to changing the AoA.

It assumes your craft is always pointing prograde unless you tell it otherwise in the configuration dialogs. FAR creates a better drag dynamic based on the shape of the craft so if your re-entering using the bottom side of a command pod, the drag is going to significantly shorten the distance it will travel than if your coming down nose first. Even still, it will never be exact with FAR or NEAR on a planet with an atmosphere.

Any help will be appreciated.

This is the appropriate release thread, it has been updated for 0.90

Edited January 22, 2015 by Alshain
They updated it for FAR and NEAR compatibility last time I checked.

It assumes your craft is always pointing prograde unless you tell it otherwise in the configuration dialogs. FAR creates a better drag dynamic based on the shape of the craft so if your re-entering using the bottom side of a command pod, the drag is going to significantly shorten the distance it will travel than if your coming down nose first. Even still, it will never be exact with FAR or NEAR on a planet with an atmosphere

I do always set AoA = Ã‚Â±180Ã‚Â° in the config window. (and then actually reenter bottom-first). And I understand that making it perfectly precise is close to impossible, but missing by half a continent? That's some pretty serious error.

Are you sure your running the right versions?

Are you sure your running the right versions?

The latest ones according to CKAN.

The latest ones according to CKAN.

Don't trust CKAN. It's good intentioned but it doesn't account for everything, like someone else taking over a project and creating a new entry for it... which is exactly what happened with Trajectories. Click the link I posted above and download it there.

Don't trust CKAN. It's good intentioned but it doesn't account for everything, like someone else taking over a project and creating a new entry for it... which is exactly what happened with Trajectories. Click the link I posted above and download it there.

I had a bit of doubt that CKAN might have outdated stuff.. Thanks for explaining the situation.
